definition: to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.english: There are schools and families to provide standard education, while books are needed for independent study.
sentences.chinese: 教育有學校和家庭的規範教育，而自修知識需要圖書。

sentences.english: He diligently worked hard to perform his duties and at the same time he dedicated himself to self-educate himself.
sentences.chinese: 年輕的火炎在努力工作之餘，也不忘了勤力自修。

sentences.english: The boy had to educate himself in the evening after finishing his work.
sentences.chinese: 這男孩工作之後在晚上還得自修。

sentences.english: My father was writing a composition in the study room.
sentences.chinese: 我的父親正在撰寫一本組成的自修室。

sentences.english: That perhaps there had been a self-improvement class in school.
sentences.chinese: 可能在學校有很多自修課。
不，我船不能自修損壞處。

sentences.english: I bought the book for studying at home.
sentences.chinese: 爲了在家自修而買了那本書。

sentences.english: Good students are exempted from attending study hall.
sentences.chinese: 成績好的學生免上自修課。

sentences.english: Tonight I went to classroom for self-study with lower efficiency, resulting from being dispirited for such a long time.
sentences.chinese: 頹廢了那麼久，今天去自修室學習了，但效率比較低。

sentences.english: To sum up, education and independent study are important to a stronger country and better-off people.
sentences.chinese: 綜上，國強民富重在教育和自修知識。

sentences.english: The last HKALE will be held in 2013, for private candidates only.
sentences.chinese: 本局將於2013年爲自修生舉行最後一屆高考。

sentences.english: This is like study hall right?
Includes cassettes, answer keys, and course instructions that are suitable for self-study and tutorial.
sentences.chinese: 學生課本隨附課程指導，教學與自修兩相宜。

sentences.english: The fourth part analyzes the enlightenment of Hunan Self-study University to us about cultivating revolutionary cadres from four sides.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，湖南自修大學培養革命幹部給我們的啓示。

sentences.english: People can learn from both, and then choose one for personal practice.
sentences.chinese: 大家可以從兩者學習，然後擇一供個人自修。

definition: diligent/industrious (in one's studies)/to study hard/to make great effort
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
to sit quietly/to meditate/to stage a sit-in
(of Taoists) to practice austerities/to practice asceticism
to comprehend (the nature of things etc)/to achieve enlightenment
